Hello @topper-123! Thanks for updating the PR.









Cheers ! There are no PEP8 issues in this Pull Request. :beers: 

##### Comment last updated on January 08, 2019 at 14:54 Hours UTC
merge master
@topper-123 can you merge master and update
is this orthogonal to #24419 ?
Functionally yes, though I will have to solve a small merge conflict after the first of these has been merged.
ok let's merge the other first
@topper-123 can you merge master and update

I've updated, including deprecated categories & ordered parameters.

However, after #24419, it is not really a burden to support categories & ordered, and constructiong a dtype is an extra step for the user, compared to just supply categories to ``.from_codes``. Should we still deprecate?
lgtm. all of the other constructors now accept dtype so this makes consistent. @TomAugspurger @jschendel  ?

Anyone else have thoughts on deprecating the categories and ordered keywords to `Categorical.from_codes`? @jorisvandenbossche?

Reading 
https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24398#issuecomment-451735620, I suspect that @topper-123 may also prefer (or be OK with) not deprecating.

Yes, I’d now prefer not deprecating, from the same resoning as you (convenience).

Also, supporting categories/ordered requires very little effort now, so no real cost wrt. code complexity.
@topper-123 do you have time today to revert the deprecation?
I'll look into it.
Ok, i’ve reverted the deprecation.
Yes, +1 on not deprecating categories and ordered

so ok with adding ``dtype`` in ``.from_codes`` as that promotes consistency, but why are folks not in favor of deprcating ``categories`` and ``ordered``? this is just moving code away from the single point of using CDT for all operations.

Mainly balancing the volume of code that is out there using categories &
orderer, against the (small) cost of supporting both.

On Tue, Jan 8, 2019 at 6:45 AM Jeff Reback <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> so ok with adding dtype in .from_codes as that promotes consistency, but
> why are folks not in favor of deprcating categories and ordered? this is
> just moving code away from the single point of using CDT for all operations.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/24398#issuecomment-452285757>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABQHIopOGnDpPo60kgmb1BgMOvTbSueTks5vBJL8gaJpZM4ZfnHF>
> .
>

> so ok with adding dtype in .from_codes as that promotes consistency, but why are folks not in favor of deprcating categories and ordered?

We have exactly the same pattern in the main `Categorical` constructor as well: users have the option to just pass `categories` or `ordered`, or a full fledged dtype. 
Deprecating it there of course has a much larger impact than for `from_codes`, but this means we have the machinery to handle the combination, so I don't really see the need to deprecate it here (certainly given that it is much more convenient to use).

6008c08a331e877d554ec0400641fe9008385b4b has some changes

* added a test for raising when both categories / ordered & dtype are passed
* updated whatsnew
* updated versionchanged / added docs

Buglet when neither `categories` nor `dtype` is provided.

```python
In [1]: import pandas as pd

In [2]: pd.Categorical.from_codes([0, 1])
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-2-e8a6a967ddf5> in <module>
----> 1 pd.Categorical.from_codes([0, 1])

~/sandbox/pandas/pandas/core/arrays/categorical.py in from_codes(cls, codes, categories, ordered, dtype)
    661
    662         if len(codes) and (
--> 663                 codes.max() >= len(dtype.categories) or codes.min() < -1):
    664             raise ValueError("codes need to be between -1 and "
    665                              "len(categories)-1")

TypeError: object of type 'NoneType' has no len()

```

fixing now.

6008c08a331e877d554ec0400641fe9008385b4b also had a bug with the tests for raising when both `categories` and `dtype` were used. The test I added used `Categorical()` instead of `Categorical.from_codes`. That's fixed now.
+1 to the changes made by @TomAugspurger
Thanks. Merging in a few hours if now objections.
yeah this is ok.
